repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Supreme Court of the United States

did.abstract: Court documents relating to Workmen's Compensation cases

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of court documents relating to Workmen's Compensation cases, 1919 to 1931.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Workmen's Compensation Cases Court Records #5359. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Knickerbocker Ice Company vs. Lillian E. Stewart

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief filed by permission of the Court on behalf of Lillian E. Stewart, Defendant-in-error, by Warren H. Pillsbury (as Amicus Curiae), Representing the Industrial Accident Commission of the State of California; 48 pages

did.unittitle: Letus N. Crowell, as Deputy Commissioner for the Seventh Compensation District of the United States Employees' Compensation Commission v. Charles Benson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Petition for a writ of certiorari to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit, and brief in support thereof

did.unittitle: Letus N. Crowell, as Deputy Commissioner for the Seventh Compensation District of the United States Employees' Compensation Commission v. Charles Benson

Industrial Accident Commission of the State of California and Joseph Hayes, Thomas Hayes, Helen Hayes, and Mary Hayes, minors, by Mary Jordan, guardian of their persons and estates vs. James Rolph Company and General Accident, Fire, and Life Insurance Cor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief of Henry C. Hunter, Amicus Curiae an Attorney for Council of American Shipbuilder's, Inc., and New York and New Jersey Dry Dock Association, and of Joseph P. Chamberlain, Amicus Curiae and Attorney for Longshoremen's Union of America; 62 pages

did.unittitle: Industrial Accident Commission of the State of California and Joseph Hayes, Thomas Hayes, Helen Hayes, and Mary Hayes, minors, by Mary Jordan, guardian of their persons and estates vs. James Rolph Company and General Accident, Fire, and Life Insurance Cor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief for Plaintiffs in error; 75 pages; 2 copies
